name: Wild in the City
description: This nature-oriented hike is meant for either residents or out-of-towners looking to experience the unique splendour of Edmonton's River Valley-- an area which boasts the title of "Largest Urban Park" (at a whopping 160km!). You'll walk through a natural Alberta landscape (just minutes from Downtown and Whyte Ave), filled with a stunning array of greens sure to impress the most avid nature-lover. As well, participants will bridge the North Saskatchewan River (twice, from two different heights!) and discover a little bit of Edmonton's unique railroad history with views of Canada's tallest working tram bridge.
